intro: Jatropha tlalcozotitlanensis, commonly known as the Tlalcozotitlan jatropha, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It produces toxic, orange-red berries that contain seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
